text: The Fly and the River
Once upon a time, there was a river.
The water was cold and clean.
The animals were very happy .
One day, a moose came to the river.
Giant Moose was very big.
Mmm ... I'm so thirsty," said Giant Moose.
Oh, no! Giant Moose is so big!
He's drinking all the water!" the animals cried.
"Our house will fall down!" cried the beavers.
"Where will we find water?" asked the muskrats.
"Where will we swim?" asked the fish.
"How can we make Giant Moose leave?" asked the beavers.
"We're small, and Giant Moose is so big," said the muskrats.
"I have an "Idea," said a small fly.
"I can make Giant Moose leave," said Fly.
All the animals laughed.
"Ha, ha! You're too small," they said.
"You can't make Giant Moose leave," said Bear.
"You're too small," they said.
"I may be small, but I'm smart," said Fly.
"And I have an idea."
Fly flew over to Giant Moose.
He bit Giant Moose on the leg.
"Ouch! Who bit my leg?" cried Giant Moose.
He bit Giant Moose on the neck.
"Ouch! Who bit my neck?"
Giant Moose kicked.
Fly bit Giant Moose on the ear.
"Ouch! Who bit my ear?"
Giant Moose shook his head.
Fly bit Giant Moose all over.
"Ouch! Stop biting me!" cried Giant Moose.
"Leave our river!" ordered Fly.
Hooray! cried the animals.
"Giant Moose is leaving!
Thank you, Fly!"
The animals were happy again.
"I may be small, but I'm smart!" said Fly .
